item.title: Louvre | France to reinforce security at cultural sites after theft
item.description: The French Minister of Internal Affairs, Laurent Nuñez, will reinforce security measures in all cultural establishments, the press office announced yesterday, following a jewelry theft at the Louvre Museum in Paris. The decision was taken after a meeting with his government colleague in charge of Culture, Rachida Dati, said the same ministerial source, cited by the French news agency AFP. The institution, in the center of the French capital, remained closed yesterday, one day after a group, still at large, managed to steal multiple works of jewelry art. "The Louvre Museum will remain closed today (yesterday) for exceptional reasons. We apologize for the inconvenience", read a message published on the museum's official website. A group of four men stole jewelry on Sunday morning, in just a few minutes and when the museum was already open and with visitors inside, using a forklift machine, parked on the respective bank of the River Seine, and raising it to the height of a window on the first floor of the building. The group took eight pieces “of inestimable heritage value”, including the tiara of Empress Eugenie (wife of Napoleon III, emperor from 1852 to 1870) and two necklaces, the French Ministry of Culture reported on Sunday. That jewel alone has 212 pearls and 1,998 diamonds, according to the Louvre's description, while the pieces belonging to Queen Maria Amélia have multiple sapphires and hundreds of diamonds. This Parisian museum is the largest and most visited in the world, with nine million people enjoying part of the 35,000 works that the institution houses, in its 73 thousand square meters of space.

item.title: Cuts leave 13.7 million people at risk of extreme hunger
item.description: Cuts in humanitarian aid funding could expose up to 13.7 million people to extreme hunger around the world, the World Food Program (WFP) warned yesterday. “The humanitarian aid system is under severe pressure as partners withdraw from frontline areas, creating a void,” the Rome-based agency said in a new report titled “A lifebuoy in danger.” The UN agency said that six of its operations – in Afghanistan, the Democratic Republic of Congo, Haiti, Somalia, South Sudan and Sudan – are “facing major disruptions, which will only worsen”. WFP warned that its financing “has never been so challenging”, anticipating “a 40 percent drop” in 2025, “which will translate into a projected budget of US$6.4 billion, compared to US$10 billion in 2024”. The report does not name any countries, but points to a study published in the medical journal The Lancet, which found that 14 million additional deaths worldwide from disease, nutritional deficiencies and maternal and perinatal conditions could occur by 2030 as a result of cuts in US humanitarian aid alone. Returns and records Since US President Donald Trump's return to the White House, Washington has announced massive cuts in its foreign aid, dealing a huge blow to humanitarian operations around the world. "Program coverage has been significantly reduced and rations cut. Vital assistance to families in food disaster situations [Phase 5 of the Integrated Food Security Phase Classification/IPC] is threatened, while preparedness for future impacts has significantly decreased," warns WFP. Globally, “WFP estimates that its funding gaps could push 10.5 to 13.7 million people currently in acute food insecurity (IPC Phase 3) into a humanitarian emergency (IPC Phase 4),” the organization added. The UN agency said global hunger has now reached record levels, with 319 million people facing acute food insecurity — including 44 million at emergency levels.

item.title: Death | António Coelho dies aged 77, but leaves a legacy in Portuguese gastronomy
item.description: The founder of Restaurante António died on Sunday in Macau, due to heart problems. Behind him, he leaves a mark and an innovative concept for promoting Portuguese food in Asia A father, a friend and one of the great ambassadors of Portuguese gastronomy in Asia. Chef António Coelho died on Sunday, aged 77, due to heart problems, but leaves behind a professional career spanning almost 40 years and an influence that can be felt in several restaurants and Portuguese food chefs in Macau. Born in Portugal in 1948, António Coelho's first contact with Macau took place in 1970, when he had to complete his four-year mandatory military service. After two years, the land remained in his memory, but the future chef chose to return to Europe. In Portugal, he started working at Social Security, later moving to a clinical analysis laboratory. It was in this area that he developed his taste for gastronomy, not through work, but through various lunches and dinners in different restaurants. Increasingly interested in cooking, António decided to take a job, in 1984, in a restaurant, where he admitted to having learned to cook, according to an interview with the South China Morning Post newspaper, in 2018. The first years of António Coelho's new career were spent in Portugal, where he performed different roles as manager-administrator of the Botequim do Rei restaurant or director of the catering department at the Grande Hotel da Curia. In 1996, he had his first international experience, as director of the restaurant department at the Hotel Trópico, in Cape Verde. The experience lasts one year. Creating a legacy Returning to Macau in 1997, António worked for 10 years in different spaces, such as the restaurants Frol de la Mar, Lusitano, Lisbon, and also had a brief stay in Hong Kong, in 2002, at Restaurante Inn. However, the decisive step towards his affirmation as one of the most influential chefs of Portuguese gastronomy in Asia came in 2007, with the opening of Restaurante António. And the success that followed was not the result of chance, as said by Edgar Rodrigues, a chef who came to Macau to work on the launch of the project: “The success was based on the recipes, the quality of the food, but also the very professionalism”, says Edgar Rodrigues, to HM. "He was very attentive to his customers. If there was an order for clams à bolhão pato, he would have different recipes adapted to the nationality. For example, Koreans don't like coriander, the recipe for them didn't have coriander. Chinese customers like little salt, they were served with little salt, and locals like the more traditional recipe. In a single dish there were several ways of cooking, just to satisfy different customers", he recalls. Cristiano Tavares, currently chef at the Macalhau restaurant, also came to Macau to work at the António Restaurant. He believes that the chef found a position for Portuguese food that still influences other restaurants today. “I think his success was due to his way of being, he was a politically correct person, he had a way of working that pleased both Chinese, Korean and Japanese tourists”, explained Cristiano Tavares, to HM. "We were a street restaurant with four or five cooks. He managed to do what many large restaurants still cannot do today. Nowadays there are many restaurants with Portuguese food that open in Macau, but follow the example of what he did", he considered. Quality and spectacle In addition to the food, Restaurante António customers were seduced by the “show”. This is the vision of Marcelino Marques, António's friend and musician who for several years livened up the space's nights, with traditional Portuguese music. "The quality of the food made the space popular. He took great care in choosing the food and drinks served. He went to Portugal to choose wines from various regions, such as Douro or Alentejo, all of high quality, which were bottled under the António brand. People knew they weren't going to pay little, not that it was a space with luxury prices, it wasn't, but the quantity served wasn't small", recalled Marcelino Marques. However, the musician believes that the success was also due to a concept in which the meal was also a spectacle: "People liked listening to Portuguese music, but also being with António. He was an affable, big person and appeared in that white jacket with the flags of Portugal, China and Macau and people liked his presence and asked him to take photographs", he says. "He also opened a bottle of champagne with a sword. He did a whole ceremony and people really liked it. It was a spectacle and a party to see the cork flying out of the bottle. It worked well", he recalled. Marcelino Marques recalls that the food and the show made the restaurant very famous, especially among Japanese, Korean and Hong Kong tourists. The musician reveals that Japanese tourists booked days in advance. And this factor also contributed to the fact that António offered a glass of port wine at the end of the meal, which also led to the recognition of the Port Wine Confraternity. The success of Restaurante António led the chef to sell the space to an investment fund, becoming an ambassador for the space. The break with the fund happened in 2020, when he was fired without just cause. The case ended up in court, with António winning the case. In recent years, António took on the position of executive chef at Angela’s Café and Lounge, at the Hotel Lisboeta. A father, a friend Due to his work in Macau, António was distinguished, in 2013, by the Macao SAR Government with the MSAR Tourist Merit Medal. Also in 2015, he received the merit medal for Portuguese communities from the Portuguese Government. However, for those who worked with him, the most important thing was the relationship that went beyond the strictly professional field. "He had a big impact on Macau and for me he was like a second father. When I came to Macau I didn't have an easy life and he always held my hand", confessed Rodrigues. "He was always a person who was there for me. And I always saw him as a man of iron. In everything he did, there was a great will", he pointed out. This is a feeling shared by Cristiano Tavares. "António is my father in Macau. He worked until the last day, always with seriousness, honesty and integrity. He is an example for all the chefs in this area", he said. For Marcelino Marques, António's death is the loss of a friend. "António was the person who welcomed me to Macau and was capable of doing the same to everyone. He was strict and demanding, but he was an excellent person", he described. "Everyone knew him. He was an affable person and received people like no one else", he added.

item.title: Pop Mart, maker of Labubu, falls 10.8% in Hong Kong amid doubts about growth
item.description: Shares in Pop Mart, the Chinese company responsible for the global phenomenon of Labubu figures, sank 10.8% this Thursday, the biggest drop since April, in a new episode of volatility that contrasts with the good sales results released the day before. The devaluation reflects investors' growing caution regarding the possibility of a slowdown in the company's growth, after several quarters driven by the popularity of its collectible products. On Wednesday, Pop Mart shares rose 4.23% on the Hong Kong stock exchange, despite the negative tone of the market, following the announcement that revenue in the third quarter increased between 245% and 250%, driven by Labubu's virality on social media and the company's international expansion. According to data provided by the company, domestic sales grew 190%, while international sales soared 370%, highlighted by increases of 175% in the Asia-Pacific region, more than 740% in Europe and almost 1,270% in the United States. The strong drop recorded today is largely attributed to profit taking, after appreciation of more than 186% since the beginning of the year, and uncertainty about the sustainability of the current growth rate. The stock fell 8.1% on Tuesday, its worst performance since April, weighed down by fears of a slowdown in sales after months of euphoria. The preliminary release of results helped to temporarily dispel these concerns, but the absence of an official date for the presentation of the accounts maintains uncertainty regarding the company's future evolution. Executive chairman and founder Wang Ning expressed confidence in the long-term resilience of the Labubu character, arguing that cultural icons continue to generate revenue even after peak popularity. According to the Bloomberg agency, the explosion in demand forced the company itself to revise its internal goals upwards. If at the beginning of 2024 Pop Mart predicted a turnover of 2,800 million dollars (around 2,400 million euros), in August Wang raised this target to 4,200 million dollars (3,600 million euros), pointing to the brand's global momentum as a key factor. Founded in Beijing in 2010, Pop Mart has established itself as one of the main Asian references in the toy and collectible figures sector, combining exclusive design, limited editions and collaborations with international brands, artists and franchises. Its business model is based on so-called “surprise boxes”, which encourage repeat purchases and have created a community of fans willing to pay high premiums for rare pieces. Among its main lines is Labubu, a monster with pointy ears and a mischievous smile inspired by Norse mythology, created by Hong Kong artist Lung Ka-sing in 2015 and integrated into the company's portfolio in 2019.

item.title: Chemistry | Nobel Prize for the development of metal-organic structures
item.description: The Nobel Prize in Chemistry was awarded to Susumu Kitagawa, from Kyoto University, Richard Robson, from the University of Melbourne, and Omar M. Yaghi, from the University of California, “for the development of metal-organic structures”, the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences announced yesterday. Susumu Kitagawa, Richard Robson and Omar Yaghi have developed a new form of molecular architecture – metal-organic frameworks – that can be used to collect water from desert air, capture carbon dioxide, store toxic gases or catalyze chemical reactions. The three laureates created molecular constructs with large spaces through which gases and other chemicals could flow. The president of the Nobel Committee for Chemistry, Heiner Linque, highlighted precisely the fact that these “metal-organic structures have enormous potential, bringing previously unforeseen opportunities for personalized materials with new functions”. The research that led to the discovery of this new form of molecular architecture began nearly four decades ago, in 1989, when Richard Robson tested the use of the inherent properties of atoms by combining positively charged copper ions with a four-armed molecule. When combined, they bonded "to form a spacious, well-ordered crystal. It was like a diamond filled with countless cavities," the academy explains. Robson immediately realized the potential of his molecular construction, but it was still unstable and crumbled easily. It was chemists Susumu Kitagawa and Omar Yaghi who managed to provide a solid foundation for this construction method. Notable applications Following the discoveries of the three laureates, chemists built tens of thousands of different MOFs. Some of them could contribute to solving some of humanity's biggest challenges, with applications including breaking down traces of pharmaceuticals in the environment, capturing carbon dioxide or collecting water from desert air. The discovery also allows the separation of perfluoroalkylated and polyfluoroalkylated substances (PFAS) from water. PFAS are a group of synthetic chemical compounds known as “forever chemicals” due to their extreme persistence in the environment and in the human body. PFAS are used in a wide range of industrial and household products, such as stain- and water-resistant textiles, food packaging, non-stick cookware and firefighting foams. Its accumulation in the environment and potential health risks, including liver damage and other problems, have led to concerns and a search for safer alternatives.

item.title: Study | Trump was the main disseminator of disinformation in the USA in 2024
item.description: North American President Donald Trump was the main disseminator of disinformation in the United States of America (USA) in 2024, concluded a study by the International Center for Journalists (ICFJ). “US President Donald Trump was the dominant source and distributor of disinformation” in 2024, say the authors of the study “Disarming Disinformation: United States”. The study highlights that Trump has drawn on the functions of domestic political forces, rather than foreign state actors, as the main source of disinformation narratives in US political discourse. Furthermore, the existence of WhatsApp groups and other closed digital spaces often act as “information cocoons” that encourage rumors and other forms of misinformation. In this way, "the viral spread of misinformation and the strategic attack on journalists have emerged as interconnected threats to democracy. In an era of increasing authoritarianism and democratic backsliding, falsehoods are often used as a weapon by state actors to influence public opinion, undermine journalism and intimidate journalists." The study authors state that these factors are increasingly the North American reality, with Donald Trump “promulgating manifestly false narratives” in recent years. “The American media faces a profound information crisis, at a time of repression of freedom of expression”, the study reads. In this sense, trust in the mainstream press continues to decline in a climate of increasing attacks on the media by the Trump Government. The study published by the International Center for Journalists (ICFJ) was based on the analysis of 10,000 news and media publications during 2024, as well as a survey of 1,020 Americans.

item.title: Scientists 'reduce' the age of the Egyptian temple of Karnak, in Egypt
item.description: Researchers have carried out the most comprehensive geoarchaeological study of the Karnak temple, near Luxor, and revealed suggestive links to ancient Egyptian mythology and new data about the interaction between the complex's riverine landscape and the people who occupied the site during its almost 3,000 years of use. The results of the investigation were published on Monday in Antiquity magazine, reported the Efe news agency. Researchers from the University of Southampton, in the United Kingdom, and Uppsala University, in Sweden, participated in the study. Up to 61 sediment samples from the interior and surroundings of the temple and thousands of ceramic fragments found in the Karnak complex, located 500 meters east of the current Nile River, near Luxor, in the ancient Egyptian religious capital of Thebes, were analyzed. The researchers mapped how the landscape around the site changed throughout its history and found that, before 2520 BC, the site could not have been suitable for permanent occupation due to periodic flooding caused by the Nile's strong currents. Therefore, they placed the earliest occupation at Karnak during the Old Kingdom (between 2591 and 2152 BC). Pottery fragments found at the site corroborate this discovery, with the oldest dating between 2305 and 1980 BC. Therefore, the conclusions of this international team of researchers provide new evidence about the age of Karnak, which has been hotly debated in archaeological circles for decades. The origin of everything The ground on which the temple was founded was formed when river channels advanced west and east, creating an island of high ground in what is now the east-southeast region of the site. This emerging island laid the foundation for the occupation and initial construction of Karnak. Over the following centuries and millennia, the river channels on both sides of the site diverged further, creating more space for the development of the temple complex, as researchers have now confirmed. This new understanding of the temple's landscape bears striking similarities to an ancient Egyptian creation myth, leading the team to believe that the decision to locate the temple there may have been related to the religious views of its inhabitants. Ancient Egyptian texts from the Old Kingdom indicate that the 'Creator God' manifested himself as high ground emerging from the lake, and researchers have found that the island where Karnak was founded is the only known area of ​​high ground surrounded by water in the region. Thus, archaeologists have suggested that the Theban elites chose the location of Karnak to be the abode of a new form of 'Creator God', alluding to Amun-Ra, the supreme god of ancient Egypt, since the location fit perfectly into the mythological setting of the highlands that emerged from the surrounding waters as the origin of the formation of the Universe.

item.title: Kiang Wu | Association received 234.14 million patacas
item.description: The Kiang Wu Hospital Charitable Association received almost 9 out of every 10 patacas distributed in support by the Health Services in the third quarter. In total, 270.35 million patacas were allocated in subsidies The Kiang Wu Hospital Charity Association received 234.14 million patacas in subsidies paid by the Health Services, which in the third quarter of this year totaled 270.35 million patacas. The data was revealed last week, and means that for every 10 patacas distributed by the SS in support, practically nine end up deposited in the private hospital's accounts. The main supports were declared as “subsidy for the inpatient service”, referring to different months of the year, in a total of four subsidies. All of this support for the inpatient service amounted to more than 40 million patacas, with the highest amount being reached in May, with a tranche of 43.04 million patacas. In March, the amount was 41.74 million patacas, in July it dropped to 41.36 million patacas and in April it was 40.21 million patacas. These transfers represented 166.35 million patacas of the total 234.14 million received by the institution. The second largest type of support granted by the Health Services to Kiang Wu was due to the “protocol subsidy to finance the medical expenses of cardiac patients”. As part of this support, four monetary tranches were paid, corresponding to four months. In March, financing of medical expenses for cardiac patients reached the highest value, with a total of 12.70 million patacas. In May, the value was 9.87 million patacas, while in April it was 7.68 million patacas and in June 7.48 million patacas. Other smaller supports involved subsidizing the operation of the Hong Ling Center, expenses with examination services for cervical cancer screening, external vaccination consultations and subsidizing audit expenses for the Kiang Wu School of Nursing for the year 2023. Regular customers As for the associations supported by the SS, the Federation of Workers' Associations of Macau (FAOM) received 18.37 million patacas, with the majority of the subsidies going to the rehabilitation nursing services of the Recovery Center. The SS granted the center three tranches of 4.57 million patacas, for the operation of the center in the months of July, August and September. Other support to FAOM aimed at “providing external consultation services”, with monthly support amounting to just over 1 million patacas. On the podium of the most supported institutions, the Tong Sin Tong Charitable Association also appears, receiving 9.48 million patacas. Among this support, the largest share was justified with the “provision of external consultation and treatment services” in the months of September, August and July. In all periods there was a fixed subsidy of 3.08 million patacas. However, there was also other smaller support, with subsidies of around 50 thousand patacas officially justified with a “fissure sealant program”. List of institutions The distribution of the 270.35 million patacas by the SS covered 12 local institutions. In the list, it is possible to find other associations such as Santa Casa da Misericórdia de Macau, which received around 103 thousand patacas, and Cáritas de Macau, to which 315 thousand patacas were distributed. In the case of these two institutions, the support was due to the provision of medical care in local nursing homes. The names of the supported institutions also include the New Chinese Youth Association of Macau, which received 5.17 million patacas, to support the recovery center in providing external consultations or cancer screening. This association also received a subsidy of 160 patacas, the lowest of those awarded, related to HIV virus screening tests.

item.title: Association leader says HK learns from Macau elections
item.description: Hong Kong is going to elections for the Legislative Council (LegCo), the local parliament, on December 7th and in connection with this event, Lo Man-tuen, president of the association China Peaceful Development General Summit of Hong Kong-Macao-Taiwan Diaspora, stated that the Hong Kong rulers have already gone to Macau to learn from the experiences of the last electoral act, which elected deputies via direct and indirect access to the Legislative Assembly (AL). This information was expressed in an opinion article published by the newspaper Ming Pao, where the leader highlights the high turnout of Macau voters at the polls, with a participation rate of 53.35 percent. Lo Man-tuen also recalled that the participation rate in the elections by public servants was very high, so the politician understands that learning from Macau's electoral experience serves as an example for mobilization in the Hong Kong elections, using “all efforts”. "All associations and entities in Hong Kong will organize electoral activities. I believe that there will be a great unprecedented mobilization and that Hong Kong society will show up [to vote]. Of course, the turnout rate will rise and surpass the numbers of previous elections", reads the opinion article. Concordant positions This opinion by Lo Man-tuen comes after the Hong Kong and Macau Affairs Office published an article last week highlighting the importance of holding elections in Hong Kong, warning of anti-China forces that could disturb the territory, interfering or even interrupting the election. Lo Man-tuen references this article, reporting that recently “several bizarre theories that interrupt the elections” have emerged, such as the “fabricated false allegation that there is ‘interference by the Central Government in the elections”, or when the “bless list [of candidates accepted by the Central Government] was released”. The author of the article also gives the example of speeches that boycott the elections. It should be remembered that the elections for the VIII LA of Macau ended on September 14th, registering an electoral participation of 11 percent more compared to the previous elections, in 2021, with 175,272 voters voting. This number of voters broke a historic record after 1999, when the administration of the territory passed from Portugal to China. The spokesperson for the Hong Kong and Macau Affairs Office spoke the day after the elections, speaking of the successful holding of the elections, something that was a “remarkable achievement in fully implementing the principle of ‘Macau governed by patriots’ and promoting a high-quality democracy that adapts to the real conditions of Macau”.

item.title: Waldo and Emperor | Government coordinates changes for 182 workers
item.description: The satellite casinos Waldo and Emperor Palace, linked to Galaxy and Sociedade de Jogo de Macau, respectively, close this week, which will require changes to the gaming tables and the roles of 182 workers. The Gaming Inspection and Coordination Services Directorate says it is coordinating the situation with operators The Waldo and Emperor Palace casinos are permanently closing their doors this week. In the case of Waldo, linked to the Galaxy group, the closure is scheduled for Friday, 31st, at 11:59 pm, while the Emperor casino, linked to Sociedade de Jogo de Macau (SJM), will close on Thursday, 30th. The closing of these two gaming spaces occurs in the context of the end of satellite casinos by the end of the year, December 31st. In a statement, the Directorate of Gaming Inspection and Coordination Services (DICJ) promises to “strictly supervise the closure procedures of the aforementioned casinos, in order to ensure that they proceed in a stable and orderly manner and that all legal procedures are being duly complied with”. At issue are changes to the gaming tables and the roles of 182 workers, 71 at the Emperor Palace casino and 111 at Waldo. In a statement, Galaxy determined that Waldo's gaming tables “will be relocated to other casinos” under the group's operation, being “committed to safeguarding local employment”. In concrete terms, “members currently working at Waldo Casino will be transferred to other casinos or non-gaming related roles, based on operational needs, with all contractual terms of employment remaining unchanged”. Galaxy also promises to provide these workers with “a series of professional training programs to support their transition to new work environments and ensure continued professional stability”. As far as Emperor Palace is concerned, the same promise of “protecting local employment” also remains. All employees “will remain employed, being transferred to other company casinos to perform gaming-related functions, according to operational needs”, highlights SJM in a note. In the case of residents who work for Emperor and who are not directly hired by SJM Resorts, “they will be invited to apply for related vacancies within the group, with priority in hiring under equal circumstances, and will receive the necessary support, depending on the actual situation, to facilitate a smooth transition”, it is stated. The DICJ promises, in conjunction with the Directorate of Services for Labor Affairs, “to ensure strict compliance with the commitments assumed by SJM and Galaxy, with regard to the relocation of the same workers, as well as effective guarantees regarding remuneration, benefits and working conditions”. Money to be traced Regarding the redemption of game chips, from Saturday, November 1st, “valid chips with the Galaxy Waldo logo can be redeemed at designated counters at Galaxy Macau Casino or StarWorld Casino”. In the case of the Emperor Palace casino, SJM describes that all gaming machines and tables “will be transferred to other company casinos in order to continue serving our valued customers”, while “customers who have chips, deposits or cash discounts accumulated at the Emperor Palace casino, and which have not been redeemed after its closure, will be able to visit other casinos operated by SJM Resorts from October 31st for follow-up agreements”, it reads. Regarding this aspect, the DICJ promises to “designate employees to supervise, ‘in loco’, the formal closure process, ensuring compliance with procedures with regard to the appropriate treatment of cash and game chips stored in the treasury”, among other matters.

item.title: Education | Defended creation of learning vouchers
item.description: Chan Lai Kei, a deputy linked to the Fujian community, questioned the Government about the idea of ​​creating learning vouchers, outside the education system, which would be awarded annually to students with economic difficulties, in order to alleviate the burden on families. According to a written statement, the deputy argued that, currently, the subsidies granted by the Government take place in a school context, but the courses available in schools may not meet the needs of all students. In turn, the Continuous Development and Improvement Programme, aimed at courses outside the school system, is only aimed at residents over 15 years old, meaning that anyone aged between 6 and 14 has to pay for courses outside of school in full, without any support. According to Chan Lai Kei, the lack of financial support in this area means that there are limitations to the development of students' potential, also making improvements in terms of social diversity and the achievement of greater educational equity in the long term difficult.

item.title: Macau Forum | Promoted digital economy in colloquium
item.description: The “Colloquium on Digital Economy between China and Portuguese-speaking Countries” ended on Friday. The event kicked off on October 13th and was promoted by Forum Macau, with the secretary-general, Ji Xianzheng, stating that the event aimed to promote “new technologies, such as artificial intelligence and the digital economy, with the aim of promoting the digitalization of trade and investment in countries participating in Forum Macau”. Furthermore, in his speech, Ji Xianzheng highlighted the importance of “fostering technological innovation and the modernization of cross-border industrial cooperation”. Forum Macau also highlights, in the same note, that this colloquium “allowed to speed up and encourage the parties involved to jointly explore the opportunities provided by the digital economy, overcoming risks and challenges, supporting business development and achieving mutual benefits”. Ensa Indjai, as rotating representative of the colloquium, “expressed that China has shown the world the strength of its digital integration strategy, artificial intelligence and new technologies, opening paths for strengthening relations with Portuguese-speaking countries”.

item.title: Recycled Water | Target of 10 percent set
item.description: The government intends that “in the long term” around 10 percent of the water consumed in Macau will be recycled. The goal was reiterated yesterday, through a statement from the office of the Secretary for Transport and Public Works. “The medium-term goal is for recycled water consumption to represent 5 percent of Macau’s total water consumption, with the long-term goal to exceed 10 percent”, it was announced. This is seen as a way to “further save precious water resources, create greater value for its sustainable development and build a Macau city more oriented towards water saving”. According to the same statement, “Macau faces a significant shortage of fresh water” and 99 percent of the raw water consumed comes from the interior. The same data indicates that since the end of 1999, “the demand for water has registered a sharp increase, the volume of raw water supplied to Macau in 2024 reached around 105 million cubic meters, which represents an increase of more than 83 percent”.

item.title: Economy | Nick Lei asks for new consumption card
item.description: In a written interpellation, deputy Nick Lei asked the Government to study the possibility of granting another round of the consumption card, similar to what happened during the pandemic. According to the legislator linked to the Fujian community, the elderly and disabled have great difficulties using the current model of encouraging consumption, which adopts a discount policy. Previously, the card allocated an amount that could be used, regardless of any spending by the elderly. According to the deputy, if the Government is unable to issue a consumer card to all citizens, it should at least support vulnerable groups, such as the elderly, disabled and people with lower incomes. The law also asks the Executive to carry out a study on the effectiveness of the current model.

item.title: Normal People
item.description: In 2018, a book came out that quickly became a bestseller, Normal People by Sally Rooney. In 2020, a television series inspired by the book came out, which, with the same name, also became a success. It is a story about two young people, an Irish boy and an Irish girl, from their final year of secondary school, in Sligo, in the west of Ireland, until the end of their degree at Trinity College, in Dublin. People who fall in love, who get confused and who have sex – play the game of intimacy as best they can and delve into fractured and painful issues. Rooney shows that true intimacy is not built on desire, but on the ability to manage, or allow, emotional sharing. The story is a cliché. A girl who is not popular at school, but who comes from a financially advantaged family background, and a boy who is quite popular at school and who comes from a working class background. They become sexually and emotionally involved in an affair that both brings them together and separates them. They enter the same college and continue to go back and forth between an inordinate passion and moments of incomprehension. But that's where the cliché ends, because the way we are transported to the inner worlds of emotional expression is so rich, it removes us from the usual melodrama and transports us to a reality that is better known to us: ours, with its nuances and confusions. The book is called Normal People because what it portrays is real and normal. In this story, sexual and physical consent is crossed by an emotional layer that makes it complex. Exploring questions about power, class and the erotic, the characters navigate that world, each with their own distinct capacity for emotional and financial fulfillment. Intimacy is a game of power, of who opens or closes doors to harmony. And the places the characters inhabit are close and distant at the same time, as if they were lost in harmony with one another. Marianne, despite her background, comes from a problematic family that taught her that her wishes, or her existence, were not important. And in this empty space, she offers the other space to overcome limits: she does not choose to give in; she just doesn't know how to contain it. Connell, who lives lost, not knowing where he belongs, finds in Marianne a way to integrate into a world different from his own, which challenges and confuses him. The events are recounted in the intimacy of each person's thoughts, and we see how they awaken diametrically opposed perceptions. Reality ceases to exist and perception shapes what we do and feel. And in moments of physical intimacy, the body becomes the only place where the truth manifests itself. Sex is not a climax, but a way of communicating – the only space where they can say what words could not. Eroticism, according to the author, is pure vulnerability. In this story there are no villains, no heroes, just people – some say it portrays the lives of millennials in particular, in the confusion of being with others in the current context of labor and even geopolitical instability. Sex “isn't like that with other people”, as they confess to each other, and the romance and eroticism of the story lives in these explicit moments, others silent ones. With a fragmented timeline, we follow the two characters in significant stretches over five years. The rhythm presented to us reveals another mundane fact; they are growing. The relationship between Marianne and Connell is symptomatic of the growing pains that accompany them in discovering who they are – just normal people.

item.title: Musk's billion-dollar plan (2)
item.description: Last week, we talked about Tesla's proposal to award its Executive Director, Elon Musk, 1 billion dollars in shares as a performance bonus, on condition that he achieves a series of objectives. These objectives would be: First, reverse the recent decline in car sales. Second, develop the business of selling autonomous cars, etc. After all targets are met, not only would Tesla's value and profits increase significantly, but Musk would receive huge financial compensation, thus benefiting both parties. However, as autonomous driving technology is not yet fully developed, and countries around the world will review road legislation in light of this innovation, third-party insurance coverage will also undergo changes. These factors create uncertainty and could affect Tesla. Today, we will continue to analyze the impact that the 1 billion share compensation plan will have on Tesla, Musk and shareholders. Third, Tesla's plan to manufacture 5,000 to 10,000 Optimus humanoid robots by 2025. The aim is to create robots that can replace manual workers, such as porters, domestic workers, etc. However, Optimus' technology is not yet perfected. Many AI companies are working hard to achieve this same purpose. It remains to be seen whether Tesla will be successful in its research and whether it will become the first company to dominate the robotics market. Fourth, Tesla's Shanghai Energy Storage Giga factory began production last February. The company intends to work with a single energy solutions operator that provides energy generation, storage and management services to complement the automotive, robotics, supercomputer and energy businesses. This objective requires extremely high standards for both software and hardware. Tensions between China and the United States could have consequences for the import and export of products, a factor that is beyond Tesla's control. Fifth, the fact that Musk runs several AI companies makes his attention dispersed, and some of his public statements have had an impact on Tesla's image. The performance bonus he should have received for his work in 2018 is currently under appeal and it is not yet known whether the 2025 bonus will be approved by shareholders and the courts. These are all issues that Musk must consider. In the $1 billion performance bonus plan, Musk embodies three essential qualities in a successful business tycoon. Firstly, his management of several companies demonstrates his dedication to his work and reveals effort and passion. Second, once you reach your goals, your Tesla shares will increase from 13 percent to 25 percent. By strengthening his control over the company, Musk can continue to develop the business and lead it into the next decade of prosperity, proving his commitment to future growth. Third, Musk has a deep sense of adventure and, by taking risks, creates great benefits for the company and for himself. Only by transforming Tesla into an unprecedented technological company will Musk be able to reap substantial rewards, linking his personal assets to the company's value in the long term. Tesla's board of directors hopes that this plan will ensure Musk's focus on his project over the next decade, leading the company towards business transformation and profit growth. If the investigation is successful, Tesla could generate substantial profits. Failure can nullify all investments and result in losses. Risk is the essence of business. Profits and losses are precisely the consequence of taking risks. Compared to the 8.5 billion that the company is worth and its 400 billion in profit, the 1 billion prize is just a drop in the ocean. It is not a significant amount for Tesla, but it unites the interests of the company, its shareholders and Musk, cementing a common destiny. The success of Tesla's business means increased shareholder dividends, a rise in share value and a satisfied set of shareholders. However, some of them may be afraid that Musk will not meet all the objectives proposed by the company, and that as he has more shares, the participation in the capital of these shareholders will be diluted. This plan will make it more difficult for them to pass resolutions that secure their interests in the future. In this scenario, Tesla may become unable to do without Musk, some shareholders may feel he is indispensable, but Musk may leave when his goals are achieved. We have to wait for the result of the Tesla shareholder meeting that will take place in November and see if Musk can create another legend in the business world. item.title: What has this come to?
item.description: A 14-year-old minor kills his mother with his father's gun. We have become accustomed to reading sad news about children who steal their mother's jewelry for certain vices or who beat their mother or father because they don't give them money to buy drugs. Now the red line has been crossed. A minor says that “my mother bothered me a lot”, takes his father's gun and kills his mother without appeal or aggravation. What this has come to. The mother, Susana Gravato, 49 years old, was a PSD councilor at the Vagos City Council. The court has already decided to commit the minor to a closed regime and he may then remain in the same situation for another three years. The minor committed the crime in such a conscious way that, after the act, he even simulated a robbery scenario at home. When we spoke to a psychologist, she told us that the change in children's education these days is terrifying. That social networks are one of the reasons why violence is becoming commonplace and that legislation needs to change a lot with regard to access to digital. Miguel Sousa Tavares defended the gradual ban on social networks, stressing that “They are ruining our way of life”. We live in a time of education through conditioned reflex, added the psychologist, to continue highlighting "that perhaps because we are being overtaken by dogs. We live in a time where everything is the consequence of a pseudo-trauma that ignorance can easily treat and that does nothing but prolong and worsen the disease." We read Freud very early on, and we soon realized that, in Freud, almost everything revolved around frustration and repressed sex. Then, as was fashionable, we read Piaget thinking it would help us educate our children. We were wrong. Piaget educated, but he taught us. We discovered that educating children is not limited to theories, religions or fashions. Raising children, first and foremost, must be an act of love, otherwise the reverse side of the coin could be fatal. In fact, the country, once considered peaceful, was shocked to learn that a daughter tried to stab her father to death and gouge out his eyes to simply keep a house, and the next day, a 14-year-old son killed his mother with his father's hidden pistol because “his mother was boring with her schoolwork”. Right, that is to say that he immediately “killed” his father and killed himself too. Madness contaminates and so does evil. They are identical twins. The Portuguese did not want to believe that the red line had been crossed and that now children were killing their parents. A few years ago, we met José Manuel Anes, who was president of the Criminal Security and Terrorism Observatory. A man experienced in all aspects of life, security, crime and espionage. We cannot understand what education Anes gave his daughter Ana, so that she tried to stab him to death and had the “courage” to go on social media to say that she tried to kill her father because he had collaborated with the Mossad. It's incomprehensible from a daughter. José Manuel Anes had told us that the position he held was a risky one, that he was aware that one day he could be killed, but he certainly never imagined that this could happen at the hands of his own daughter Ana, who is already in prison and who confessed to the crime. Indeed, the world has changed, and for the worse in terms of the attitudes of the new generations. Parents' fault? Perhaps. However, it is still repugnant that a 53-year-old daughter takes a knife and tries to kill her father who gave her everything including an allowance until the day he was seriously attacked. What this has come to. José Manuel Anes was attacked inside his own house. Five years ago, Anes was persecuted by his daughter, with death threats on social media. The daughter intended for her father to put ownership of a house in Costa de Caparica in her name. Daughter Ana Anes' theory was that she would be able to sell the house and raise the money, since she would be unemployed. This is the motive behind the crime determined by the Judiciary Police investigation. Furthermore, it was because he feared that his daughter would carry out the threats that José Manuel Anes, aged 81, began living with his current wife in the house of one of her friends, in Lisbon. Anes had received a threatening message from his daughter before the day of the crime and the very next day she rang the door of the house where she was living and Anes opened it, thinking it was the delivery of a package. He was immediately thrown to the ground by his daughter, who then attacked him with several punches all over his body. Then, with a sharp object, he hit him on the head, legs, hands and abdomen, until, finally, he pressed both of his eyes with his fingers, leaving him unable to see. What a macabre scene: a daughter who tries to kill an 81-year-old father, just for the sake of money. On any given day, every month we have a father killed by a son. What this has come to… P.S. – This was my 250th column. I would like to fraternally thank Director Carlos Morais José for the invitation he made to me about five years ago to be in contact with the readers of this magnificent newspaper.

item.title: Global Strategic Triangle (I)
item.description: (Continued from October 23rd edition) Exaggerating the Russian threat serves both industry and domestic politics. At the lower end of the scale, Palestinians continue to be targets of extermination and displacement by Jerusalem, in a persistent search for living space. They are forgotten victims, especially by those who call themselves their friends. The crisis of social cohesion in the triangle of regional powers is evident. In Israel, internal fragmentation is dramatic. External wars function as an escape valve to avoid internal collapse between centrifugal tribes, where the retreat of ultra-Orthodox Jews to fight for the Zionists is more than alarming. In Iran, tension is latent, the result of the progressive secularization of society and the regime, which the West continues to attribute to the ayatollahs as a caricature that is not amusing, and the collapse of the birth rate. In Türkiye, the situation is manageable, despite the growing gap between the regime's pragmatic Islamism and the secular, almost atheist, widespread among young people. The fertility rate fell from 2.38 children per woman in 2001 to 1.48 in 2024, a sign of a profound demographic transition. As for the triangle of great powers, the United States maintains interest only to avoid Israel's self-destruction, caused by unwinnable wars. But the commitment is decreasing. Trump does not trust Netanyahu, who tries to instrumentalize him, but depends on him for weapons. Israeli extravagances are tolerated, as the American interest lies in supervising the balance between the three protagonists, the United States, Russia and China in addition to Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates, converted to the open field game, with China and even Iran. The red line of the Persian bomb, with Saudi and Turkish consequences, remains a point of tension. With no other perspective than to push everyone further. Russia has recently rediscovered its Soviet-era Middle Eastern partners, starting with Syria, trying to open a southwestern breach in the American device west of the vertical Murmansk-Cairo eastern border of the American sphere of influence in the post-global era. The fall of al-Assad dealt a severe blow to Russian influence in the region. Moscow is trying to defend access to its only naval base in the Mediterranean, reduced but not compromised. Putin strengthens military and energy ties with Iran, as the Ukrainians well know, the target of swarms of Persian drones, while negotiating with Saudi Arabia, together with the Americans, the price of oil. Erdogan extends his provinces to almost all of Libya, while offering ambiguous support in the Black Sea and in secret negotiations over Ukraine. But the rivalry between the Second and Third Rome is destined to last until the last days. Finally, the strategic triangle between Israel, Turkey and Iran in the Middle East, between Suez, Bab al-Mandab and Hormuz, adds a layer of complexity to the global panorama. They are islands of strong identity in a sea of ​​para-States and fragmented communities, where stability is always relative. The war in Ukraine, far from being an isolated episode, is a mirror of a world in transition. A world where the balance between powers, the redefinition of alliances and the management of regional conflicts will determine the course of history. And where peace, more than an ideal, will be the result of patient and multilateral diplomatic engineering.

item.title: FRC | Hu Jiawen exhibition to see from today
item.description: The Rui Cunha Foundation (FRC) presents a new exhibition today. It is “Radiant Blue”, with works by Hu Jiawen, an artist who explores all her creativity in connection with the universe of Gongbi painting and other traditional Chinese painting techniques. To view until November 8th The artist Hu Jiawen presents today, at the Rui Cunha Foundation (FRC), several of her painting works, in a new exhibition open until the 8th of November. This is “Radiant Blue”, with its opening scheduled for today, starting at 6:30 pm, where “the spectator is invited to immerse themselves in a world where the traditional and the contemporary coexist, through the dialogue between the calm lines of meticulous brushwork and the intense metallic burns, of blue paint and gold leaf”, highlights the FRC, in a statement. This exhibition includes 30 works composed of Gongbi painting, traditional Chinese painting, experimental painting, contemporary painting, mixed media with metal foil, and bronze sculpture. Highlight is the “accurate selection” of works by the curator and renowned local artist, Chang Kuok Meng, in an exhibition organized by the FRC, the Macau Youth Art Association and the Macau Fine Arts Artists Association. According to the organization's manifesto, this solo exhibition is an “exploration of visual art rooted in meticulous traditional figure painting, integrating experimental techniques of Indian ink, blue printing and gold leaf burning”. Here, “the artist reconstructs oriental aesthetics from traditional and contemporary perspectives, creating an environment of painting on silk and rice paper, which embodies both classical meaning and modern consciousness”. Go beyond the usual According to Hu Jiawen, “Radiant Blue” reveals the “effort to leave the comfort zone and go beyond the label of ‘Gongbi Figure Painting'”, where the artist “uses different means” to try to “transmit the emotions and status of women in virtual and in-person spaces, hoping that the public will appreciate the beauty that arises from imperfection and transformation”. There are “female figures in the works that often exist in a space-time intertwined with reality and illusion”, showing “the delicate representation of meticulous brushwork”, or even “the transformative quality of experimental paint and the deep layers of blue printing”. These “are further highlighted by the intervention of burnt gold leaf, in the sense that its cracks and imperfections do not mean damage, but rather give the figures character and a sense of temporal texture”. Then there is “the light and hue created by the burnt gold leaf that suggest the fusion of emotions and the impression of memories”. Hu Jiawen has a bachelor's degree in Visual Arts Education from Macau Polytechnic University and a master's degree in Education from the University of Macau. Currently residing in the territory, she dedicates herself to artistic education and is employed by the Canton International Art Fair, in addition to performing other functions in various artistic organizations. His works have been exhibited in places such as Beijing, Guangzhou and Macau, receiving awards and being included in several collections. He is proficient in different genres, with a special talent for traditional Chinese painting, sketching, oil painting, engraving, ceramics, and fine brushstroke Gongbi figure painting.

item.title: Exhibition on intangible cultural heritage at the Macau Museum
item.description: A new exhibition on the intangible cultural heritage of the Greater Bay Area opens to the public this Saturday, entitled “A New Impulse – Cultivated Greater Bay Area, A Brilliant Intangible Cultural Heritage: Exhibition of the Intangible Cultural Heritage of the Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macao Greater Bay Area”. The initiative can be seen at the Macau Museum until March 15th next year. Organized with several museum entities in the province of Guangdong and Hong Kong, the exhibition “will encompass a thematic exhibition, interactive demonstrations of artisanal techniques, workshops and the sale of cultural and creative products related to intangible cultural heritage”. The exhibition presents “more than 50 manifestations representative of the intangible cultural heritage of the Greater Bay Area, including Cantonese embroidery, colored paper crafts, wood carvings and Cantonese porcelain”. The aim is, in this way, “to make the public aware of the artisanal techniques of the intangible cultural heritage in the traditional cultural context of Lingnan, as well as the oriental aesthetics formed through the fusion of Chinese and Western cultures, as evidenced in the intangible cultural heritage of the Greater Bay Area”. The great interaction In connection with the opening of this exhibition, there will be “interactive demonstrations of artisanal techniques” on the weekend, Saturday and Sunday, in places such as the Fortaleza do Monte garden and the Macau Museum. These demonstrations cover various arts, including Foshan Chinese New Year woodblock painting, Hakka qilin dancing from Hang Hau in Sai Kung, Portuguese tile making and painting, Portuguese folk dance and lion dance. Also included are demonstrations of Wing Chun martial arts, Choi Lei Fat martial arts, Naamyam Narrative Songs, Taoist ritual music and Baatyam percussion. The entire program can be seen on the Macau Museum portal. The workshops will also take place on the 1st and 2nd of November, at the Macau Museum, Casa do Mandarin and Zheng Guanying Memorial Museum, focusing on puppet theater for the whole family, creating bookmarks made with gold thread embroidery or even creating Cantonese opera accessories. A highlight is the holding, this Saturday, of two guided tour sessions at the exhibition. The deadline for registering for some activities is Wednesday, which can be done on the Macau Single Account platform. In addition to all the activities mentioned above, between Saturday and Monday, the sale of cultural and creative products related to intangible cultural heritage will take place in the garden of Fortaleza do Monte. This exhibition is “the first large-scale traveling exhibition dedicated to the intangible cultural heritage of the Greater Bay Area”, and the first edition, entitled “Celebrating National Day - Auspicious Intangible Cultural Heritage of the Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macao Greater Bay Area”, was held in Hong Kong in October last year. Earlier this year the same exhibition was held in Shenzhen, called “New Year in Shenzhen: Grand Gathering in the Greater Bay Area”.

item.title: Influencers | “CreatorWeek Macao 2025” starts today
item.description: Between today and tomorrow, the first event dedicated to the world of influencers will take place in Macau, entitled “CreatorWeek Macao 2025”. This is an event promoted by the Tourism Services Directorate (DST) that includes the “CreatorWeek Conference”, which takes place today at the Grand Lisboa Palace. Tomorrow, the “CreatorWeek Academy” takes place, in the same tourist resort. According to a note from DST, these two events “aim to create a platform for content creators, companies and local groups producing new media and social media leaders”, with the hope that this platform “will provide commercial value”. It is hoped that an event entirely dedicated to “influencer” activity can look at the “uniqueness” of Macau and “contribute to promoting the development, abroad, of creators from the interior of China”, in addition to also helping “international creators to enter China to get to know Chinese culture”. MGTO also hopes that this week will “elevate the image of Macau as an ‘internet-famous’ tourist city, promoting the development of the content creator economy”. The “CreatorWeek Conference” takes place between 10 am and 6 pm and aims to debate “the cultural integration of Chinese and Western social networks and platform trends”, without forgetting “the current situation and the future of the creator economy”. The event features dozens of speakers, including, for example, Ben Wong, director of marketing operations at Google in China. In turn, the “CreatorWeek Academy” takes place between 2pm and 5pm and “has the participation of talents from the sector and leaders from the main platforms”, discussing topics such as “From Local Voice to Global Influence”, “Agents, MCNs and Creators: Building Sustainable Careers” or “Creating a Community with Snapchat”, among many others.

item.title: Edition celebrating 15 years of Oktoberfest Macau has already started
item.description: Another edition of Oktoberfest Macau began on Friday, which until November 2nd takes place at MGM Cotai. According to a statement from the gaming operator, this is an edition that makes “a toast to 15 years” of the event that has brought to the territory “the authentic flavor and spirit of the iconic German beer festival”. Oktoberfest Macau has received, over 15 years, more than 190 thousand participants. On Friday, at the opening ceremony, Kenneth Feng, president and CEO of MGM China, said that this party is “not only a celebration, but also a connection”. "It is this feeling of togetherness that has sustained the spirit of the festival for the past fifteen years, making it an eagerly-awaited annual celebration, filled with laughter and memories. This year, the festival will welcome its 200,000th guest, a true milestone that reflects MGM's long-standing commitment to developing cultural and tourism products for Macau," he added. Music and sausages Anyone who goes to Oktoberfest can be sure that they will find the typical German beer and sausages that are the delights of the party, and this year the Högl Fun Band returns, directly from Munich. This group promises to “take the stage with lively Bavarian melodies, leading the audience in chorus with the song that is the original theme of the festival”, the song “Nei Hou, Macau!”. In order to celebrate 15 years of existence, MGM created a “special photo booth” for this edition, so that participants can take themed photographs about Oktoberfest, in addition to the “Best Costume Award” debuting. Here, the public is invited “to dress up in themed costumes and fully embrace the spirit of Oktoberfest”. The space also offers activities designed for children. The party takes place until November 2nd, from 6pm to midnight, on the first terrace of MGM Cotai, and tickets for the event must be purchased.

item.title: PJ | Indicted for kidnapping and rape of lover
item.description: The Judiciary Police (PJ) announced the arrest of a 34-year-old man on suspicion of kidnapping, rape and serious harm to the physical integrity of his lover. The case took place in a local hotel, after the two began an extramarital relationship last year. According to the PJ's version, the man and woman are from the interior, where they met and began a romantic relationship. However, the most recent meeting in Macau ended with the alleged commission of several crimes. After a meeting in a restaurant on Saturday morning, the woman was blackmailed into going to the man's hotel room in Macau. If she refused, the lover threatened to reveal the relationship to her husband and his entire family. The woman eventually gave in, but when she arrived at the hotel room she was raped and kidnapped for at least an hour. After the first attack, the woman contacted her sister to ask for help and ended up being attacked, with an ashtray on her head, in addition to being strangled with a cell phone charger cable. Given his injuries, the man allowed the victim to contact his sister, who in turn alerted the police. The suspect ended up being detained by the authorities, and when questioned by the authorities he asserted his right to silence.

item.title: Light Rail | Only two in every 100 young people use transport
item.description: Poor network coverage and the distance to residential areas mean that young people rarely use the metro. Among users, the main reason is the desire to have a different experience Only 1.5 percent of young people in Macau say they use the Light Rail as their main means of transport, that is, less than two out of every 100 young people. The conclusion is part of the study prepared by the New Chinese Youth Association of Macau, the results of which were presented yesterday. Based on a survey in which 647 young residents were questioned, aged between 18 and 44, the association concluded that the Light Rail is the least used means of transport of all those available in the territory. When asked to answer about the main means of transport in Macau, around 36.6 percent of respondents admitted that they mainly use buses. Private vehicles, such as cars or motorcycles, were indicated as the main means of travel for 31.9 percent of young people, while 26.3 percent responded that they traveled mainly on foot. Only 1.5 percent of those questioned indicated the metro as their main means of transport. Despite not being the main means of transport, 58.7 percent said they had used the metro at least once in the last year. However, almost seven in ten (68.4 percent) of these respondents were infrequent users, using every three months or less regularly. The Light Rail is still considered by users as “an experience” more than a form of transport that responds to everyday needs. Regarding the reason that led young people to choose the metro, 33.9 percent said that using it was justified “just by the experience”, while 22.1 percent said they would go to a border, and 21.3 percent said they would go to large hotels. Does not heat up or cool down Regarding the quality of the service, the largest group of young users are indifferent, with 39.3 percent responding that it is “neither good nor bad”. Conversely, 39.1 percent stated that satisfaction is “good or very good”. The results presented by the association do not allow us to know the total degree of dissatisfaction, however, there were also 14.2 percent of respondents who indicated that the experience on the metro was “not satisfactory” or “not very satisfying” Among young people who do not use the metro, 46.1 percent cited the fact that the “stations are too far from their homes” as the main reason, while 35.6 percent justified their non-use due to limited network coverage and 33.3 percent indicated that the metro does not provide direct access to the places they frequent most. One of the factors that also contributes to keeping young people away is the fact that payments made through applications that use QR technology are not accepted. Around 61.7 percent stated that due to this reason they feel less desire to use this transport. Currently, the Light Metro can be used by purchasing a ticket at ticket machines, which do not accept QR Code technology, but also at physical ticket offices. Os interessados podem também utilizar o Macau Pass, passando directamente nos torniquetes de acesso.

item.title: HK | Smuggling case worth 200 million dollars discovered
item.description: Shark fins, cigars, cell phones, pharmaceutical products and even donkey skin. These are the products discovered in two more smuggling cases discovered by the Hong Kong Customs Service (SA) on the 3rd and 7th of this month. According to a statement from this organization, the value of the goods is around 200 million US dollars, with two ships involved, one of them destined for river trade. This ship was destined for Macau and was caught by the authorities on October 3rd. Five containers destined for Taiwan were also inspected and were declared to be transporting frozen food. On October 7, the SA in Hong Kong realized that 150 tons of donkey skin were circulating here and not the declared food. The same statement indicates that the investigation continues and that “the possibility of arrests is not excluded”. Under Hong Kong's Import and Export Law, anyone found guilty of importing or exporting undeclared cargo is subject to a maximum fine of US$2 million and a seven-year prison sentence upon conviction. Seven cases last week Taking into account the holding of the National Games starting next month, the Customs Service (SA) wants to show service and admitted to having reinforced inspection efforts at the Portas do Cerco Border Post. As a result of these efforts, seven cases of smuggling were recorded between 21 and 25 October. According to a statement from the SA of Macau, within the scope of the seven cases, customs agents found a total of 120 old cell phones, often used to circumvent internet access limitations, 85 pieces of electronic products and 1344 grams of cigar. The smugglers involved residents of Macau and the Interior, aged between 38 and 64. Those involved were fined, the SA announced, under the provisions of the foreign trade law.

item.title: Courts | Departure of Portuguese judge confirmed
item.description: Judge Rui Ribeiro will leave the Macao SAR courts starting next month. The information had been made public by Lusa, which cited the judge himself as a source, and was confirmed yesterday through an order, published in the Official Bulletin. “Judge Rui Carlos dos Santos Pereira Ribeiro is dismissed, at his request, from the position of judge of the Court of Second Instance of the Special Administrative Region of Macau […] from November 1, 2025”, the document reads. According to the news agency, Rui Ribeiro asked to return to Portugal, due to uncertainty about authorization from the Portuguese Superior Council of Judiciary (CSM) to continue in the Macao SAR. The judge has been in Macau since September 1, 2008, and in Portugal he is part of the Civil Section of the Court of Appeal of Guimarães. Last week, the president of the CSM, João Cura Mariano, showed his willingness to send more judges to Macau, despite admitting that there is also a lack of human resources in Portugal With Rui Ribeiro's departure, there is only one Portuguese judge left in Macau, Jerónimo Alberto Gonçalves Santos, who serves as president of a collective court at the Base Judicial Court (TJB). Jerónimo Santos has been in the Macao SAR courts since September 1, 2005, being part of the Intellectual Property, Competition, Regulation and Supervision section of the Lisbon Court of Appeal in Portugal.

item.title: Great Bay | Projected salary increases of 3% in Macau
item.description: In the most recent Greater Bay Area Remuneration and Benefits Survey Report 2025, 15.4 percent of 39 companies in Macau point to a salary increase of around 3 percent for 2026. The technology area is the one that pays the most to a recent graduate, with a salary of 19 thousand patacas Some data on the salary panorama and benefits granted to workers in the context of the Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macao Greater Bay Area 2025 are now known, thanks to a new survey released on Friday. According to an official statement, Macau is represented by 39 companies surveyed, of which 15.4 percent expect a salary increase of three percent for next year. Meanwhile, there are “33 organizations that have not yet decided on expected salary increases”, and “no organization has indicated a salary freeze”. Forecasts for 2026 point to a salary adjustment of 3.1 percent in management or senior positions, supervisory positions or general staff, while employees in operational or customer service roles may receive increases of 3 percent. These are nicer numbers compared to this year, whose increase percentages are around 1.3 percent and 2.9 percent depending on the different professional positions. In 2022, the year of the pandemic, salary adjustments did not exceed 1 percent, and in senior or management personnel positions there was even a drop of 0.1 percent. Between the months of July 2024 and June 2025, there was an average salary increase of 1.6 percent in the 39 companies surveyed in Macau, while 24 reported a salary freeze. Excluding these companies that did not increase values, “the real average salary increase was, in general terms, in the remaining organizations, 3.4 percent”. These data refer to the 2025 Greater Bay Area Remuneration and Benefits Survey Report, which in the case of Macau includes companies linked to six sectors of activity, namely hotels and restaurants, banking, insurance, finance, culture and entertainment, or even commerce and engineering. The survey covered a total of 54,195 employees in Macau. Who pays more? The presentation of the Survey took place last Friday at the Faculty of Business Administration of the University of Macau (UM), and was carried out by this university, the Human Resources Association of the Greater Bay Area of ​​Macau and several higher education institutions in the Greater Bay Area, including the Human Resources Strategy and Development Center of the Faculty of Administration of the Hong Kong Baptist University, among others. Still in the case of Macau, it is highlighted that graduates in the area of ​​information technology are those with the highest salary at the beginning of their careers, in the order of 19 thousand patacas, while in Guangdong province, for the same type of work, a recent graduate earns around 6 thousand renminbis. If you have more advanced studies, such as a postgraduate degree or master's degree, the salary increases to 8,500 renminbis. In Guangdong province, the highest salaries for a recent graduate are in the area of ​​“R&D”, research and development of new products, with 6,500 renminbi. Those with more advanced studies than a bachelor's degree can reach a salary of 9,500 renimbis. In the case of Hong Kong, salaries for those just leaving university are higher in the engineering field, paying an average of 21,500 Hong Kong dollars currently. The survey was carried out in June this year among more than three thousand companies in the Greater Bay Area, and between the months of July and September 258 valid questionnaires were received: 39 from Macao SAR, 141 from Guangdong province and 78 from Hong Kong. In total, they cover 244 thousand employees who participated through an individualized panel system using artificial intelligence, entitled “My AI Salary Consultant”.

item.title: Black Sand | Car enters restaurant and leaves six injured
item.description: An out-of-control Lamborghini entered the window of a restaurant in Areia Preta, leaving six people injured. The case happened on Saturday afternoon, and the injured, including the driver, customers and restaurant workers, were considered by authorities to be in a “stable” situation. According to the report in the newspaper Ou Mun, the 60-year-old driver claimed to have made a mistake by pressing the accelerator pedal instead of the brake, which led to him losing control of the vehicle. The balloon test indicated that the driver had not consumed alcohol. In turn, the restaurant owner complained about the damage caused and also about the impossibility of continuing to operate the business in the near future, due to the need for major works. Authorities indicted the driver for causing physical harm through negligence, punishable by up to two years in prison. Alcohol | Driver detained for causing accident A 50-year-old man was arrested after causing an accident while driving drunk, with a level of 1.71 grams of alcohol per liter of blood. The case was revealed on Saturday, although the accident had happened on Wednesday morning. The accident was declared when authorities were called to Avenida Doutor Henry Fok, due to a rear-end collision between a light vehicle and another. However, at the scene, authorities suspected that one of the drivers had consumed alcoholic beverages, so they carried out a balloon test, which showed a result of 1.71 grams of alcohol per liter of blood. The man confessed to drinking alcohol, reporting that he had been drinking at work that morning. At the same time, he explained that he had been responsible for the accident, for not having maintained an appropriate safe distance.

item.title: Tourism | Best September ever since there are records
item.description: Despite last month's record, when the nine months of the year are considered, the number of visitors is still below what happened between January and September 2019, before the pandemic. Macau received almost 2.8 million visitors in September, 9.8 percent more than in the same period in 2024 and the highest figure ever for this month, it was announced Friday. The number of tourists passing through the territory was the highest for any month of September since the Directorate of Statistics and Census Services (DSEC) began compiling monthly data, in 1998, still during the Portuguese administration. However, more than 56 percent of visitors (1.56 million) arrived on organized tours and spent less than a day in the Macao SAR. In 2024, the Central Government announced a series of measures to support Macau, such as increasing the tax exemption limit for goods for personal use purchased by visitors from China. At the same time, the Chinese authorities expanded the list of places with “individual visas” to visit Hong Kong and Macau to 10 more cities in China. Furthermore, since January 1st, residents of the neighboring city of Zhuhai can visit Macau once a week and stay for up to seven days. As a result, the overwhelming majority (90.6 percent) of tourists arriving in Macau in September came from mainland China or Hong Kong, while fewer than 260,400 were international visitors. The city received a total of almost 29.7 million visitors in the first ten months, 14.5 percent more than in the same period in 2024 and the second highest figure ever for the start of a year. Exceptional numbers According to official data, the number of tourists passing through Macau was only surpassed between January and September 2019 – before the Covid-19 pandemic -, a period in which it registered more than 30.2 million visitors. On January 17, the director of Macau Tourism Services said she expected between 38 and 39 million visitors this year. In August, Maria Helena de Senna Fernandes set a goal of more than three million international visitors by 2025. In the first nine months of the year, Macau received almost 1.9 million tourists from abroad, 12.4 percent more than in the same period in 2024. Citizens of Saudi Arabia, Qatar, Kuwait, Bahrain and Oman began to be exempt from visas to enter the city from July 16th. Despite the increase in the number of tourists, the average consumption of each visitor in Macau, excluding casinos, fell 12.3 percent in the second quarter of the year, compared to the same period in 2024. In early May, DSEC pointed to the “change in the consumption pattern of visitors” as one of the main reasons for the 1.3 percent drop in Macau's economy between January and March. It was the first time that the territory's Gross Domestic Product shrank, in year-on-year terms, since the end of 2022, when the region began to lift restrictions due to the covid-19 pandemic. Macau received 34.9 million visitors last year, 23.8 percent more than the previous year, but still far from the record, 39.4 million, set in 2019, before the pandemic.

item.title: ZELENSKY VS ZELENSKY
item.description:
10/27/22 A Ukrainian pensioner, with the same name as the president, blames Zelensky for the prolongation of the conflict that destroyed his village. Zelensky, the villager, who never left his land, is now mortified because his favorite gravedigger died in the bomber.
